newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean Jan-Sept foreign investment up sharply.
newsitem.headline: Chilean Jan-Sept foreign investment up sharply.

text.p: Foreign investment in Chile came to $4.5 billion in the first nine months of the year, up 41 percent from the same period last year, said Economy Minister Alvaro Garcia.

Just over $3 billion entered Chile under decree law 600, which governs direct investment, Garcia told a news conference. Around $1 billion worth of investment came from the placement and transactions of Chilean-issued American Depositary Receipts, he said.
Capital transfers to existing projects accounted for investment worth $378 million.
Greatest growth was seen in investment in services, up 56 percent on last year, followed by mining, up 19 percent and investment in industrial projects, which rose 14 percent.
The foreign investment committee approved future investments totalling $4.7 billion in the first nine months of the year, up 15 percent from the same period last year.
The board gave the go-ahead to projects worth $516 million in its meeting this month.
These include a $375 million plan by Vancouver-based Methanex Corp to expand its methanol plant near the far southern port of Punta Arenas.
